problem.markdown:
WORDBUILDING really/very + adjective
You can make some adjectives stronger or weaker with really, very, or not very.

My dinner was really good. (+ +)
My dinner was good. (+)
My dinner wasn't very good. (- -)
The travel show was very interesting. (+ +)
The travel show was interesting. (+)
The travel show wasn't very interesting. (- -)

You can use very and really with these adjectives: good, bad, interesting, comfortable, nice.
You can only use really (not very) with these adjectives: great, amazing, delicious.
Read the sentences and look at the symbols in parentheses. Rewrite the sentences using very or really. 1- The trip was good. (+ +)
Answer: The trip was very good. or The trip was really good. 2- The food wasn't good. (+ +) = The food was very good. or= The food was really good. 3- The meetings were interesting. (- -) = The meetings weren't very interesting. or= The meetings weren´t very interesting. or= The meetings weren`t very interesting. 4- The party was great! (+ +) = The party was really great! 5- The weather was bad. (+ +) = The weather was really bad. or= The weather was very bad. 6- It was sunny. (- -) = It wasn't very sunny. or= It wasn´t very sunny. or= It wasn`t very sunny. 7- The flight was bad. (+ +) = The flight was really bad. or= The flight was very bad. 8- The hotel was amazing! (+ +) = The hotel was really amazing!
